Tip of the Month

Update Your GMB Holiday Hours

Did you know you can update your Google My Business listing (GMB) office hours to include special holiday hours? With the upcoming holidays, make sure your customers have your up-to-date availabilities. If you have unconfirmed hours on your GMB listing, they may be labeled as "hours may differ" appearing in orange on Google. If you have set special hours and/or list holiday hours, they will be labeled in green on Google.

Tech News

FCC Sued By Dozens of Cities After Voting to Kill Local Fees and Rules

An FCC vote to preempt local fees and rules related to cable-broadband providers has been challenged in federal court by almost 50 cities seeking to undo the order.

US Violated Constitution By Searching Phones For No Good Reason, Judge Rules

A federal court has concluded that ICE and border agents violated the 4th amendment when they searched the devices of 11 travelers without individualized suspicion.

Search Warrant Overrides 1M Users’ Choice Not to Share DNA With Cops

A Florida judge has approved a warrant that would disregard the preferences of over a million users of a consumer DNA database, allowing law enforcement to search all user data.

The Supreme Court Will Hear Google and Oracle’s Nearly Decade-Long Copyright Fight

The Court has confirmed that it will take up the years-long dispute between Google and Oracle regarding whether basic code elements can be copyrighted.

SEO News

Google Quietly Rolls Out Combined Audience Targeting for Search Campaigns

Google Ads users can now take advantage of a feature called combined audience targeting, which allows them to show ads only to people in two or more particular groups.

New SERP Feature Truncates Title Tag in Favor of Location

Google seems to be rolling out a new feature that automatically adds locations to title tags in place of some of the text, even if the location was not in the original title tag text.

Google Ads Editor Gets New Features & Support For New Campaign Types

New tools for Google Ads users include the ability to share negative keyword lists across accounts, and to search for particular errors throughout all accounts and campaigns.

5 Tips and Trends From Google Webmaster Conference

Key takeaways from the conference included Google’s ongoing emphasis on increasing support for structured data, the growth of emoji search, and tips regarding duplicative content.

Did You Know?

Google Chrome Will Block Mixed Content

Google announced that Chrome browser will begin blocking web pages with mixed content beginning December 2019. Mixed content is when a secure web page (loaded through HTTPS) also contains scripts, styles, images or other linked content that is served through the insecure HTTP protocol. You may rest assured and ignore any solicitations attempting to scare you about this update - we have made sure to load all resources on your Justia websites and blogs through HTTPS.

Social Media News

What Ads Are Political? Twitter Struggles With a Definition

After announcing that it will ban political ads on its platform, Twitter is facing challenges with regard to determining exactly how its new policy will be implemented.

Massive Facebook Document Leak Gives Ammunition to Investigators

In connection with a lawsuit by the State of California, 7,000 pages of internal Facebook documents have gone public, and may inform antitrust investigations against the company.

YouTube Launches a Redesign of Its Desktop Home Page

YouTube has unveiled a new desktop and tablet app home page design that offers users the ability to customize their home feeds.

Facebook Unveils New Logo With Unique Branding for All of Its Products

The company’s new logo configurations contain specific color schemes for each of its major products, such as the Facebook app, Messenger, Instagram, and WhatsApp.

Legal Industry News

New California Bar Study Finds Racial Disparities in Lawyer Discipline

The study revealed significant inequities in areas such as probationary discipline and disbarment, with the greatest disparities occurring between black and white male lawyers.

How Does a Lawyer Get Competent in Tech? I Asked Twitter and Got 100+ Answers

Advice to lawyers seeking a greater level of tech literacy included to begin exploring tech topics they are curious about, and to learn to communicate well with tech professionals.

Why Are Experienced Women Lawyers Leaving BigLaw? Survey Looks for Answers and Finds Big Disparities

The data indicates stark differences in women lawyers’ access to specific opportunities that would lend themselves to career success, and an alarmingly high rate of sexual harassment.

The Insider’s View On LegalTech VC Funding

A legal tech business owner describes the current venture capital funding landscape, and offers their story as an example of how legal tech is becoming integral to the legal industry.
